A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
It had it's moments for sure which I won't mention in fear of spoilers for those of you yet to see.
Nostalgic with a fresh new start\, some amazing twists and real moments of awe.
For all this the comedy got stretched beyond what it needed to be\, the originals had humor yet it was well timed and not the focus\, it gave value to the characters.
In this one it was trying too hard and lost the balance.
As a kid from the mid 70"s this is till a religious experience for lack of a better term after being out all night and reviewing a movie\, and not just any movie\, a star wars movie!
I really wanted to feel the force again and at moments I did but whether it's the change of the guard on the business decisions and licensing agreements or that may just grow on me after I take my 2 young daughters to go and see.
I saw the 3D version tonight and that in itself was a bit overdone at time and had random short cameo's in between that were more disturbing than anything. If they used that time to develop the new generation and create more attachment to the story and be involved in the development then let that be the focus as it was for every original Star Wars fan. You can't tell me we don't all have favourite moments or favourite characters from the Star Wars universe?
Moments yes moments but please turn down the hollywood and give us more raw instead of a something that needs to be dressed\, it is Star Wars after all and it's all about balance.
